column2: He indicated a button and added: "That rings a buzzer; you can hear it from the alcove, and then slip out the front door."

column2: CHAPTER XXXII.

column2: IN WHICH BLUFF IS TRUMPS.

column2: Having disposed of the girl for the moment, Travers Gladwin decided it was time to call Michael Phelan to his assistance.

column2: There was no telling what this amazing crook might do now.

column2: He was too much for him. That a thief and impostor could possess such superhuman nerve had never occurred to his untutored mind.

column2: He was a perfect dub to have let the situation reach such a stage of complexity, though the one thought uppermost in his mind was to save Helen from public ridicule and contempt.

column2: He had reasoned it out that just the uniform of Officer 666 would serve him almost as a magician's wand.

column2: He had almost counted on the thief taking one craven look at his constabulary disguise and then leaping through the window--fleeing like a wolf in the night--he, Travers Gladwin, remaining a veritable hero of romance to sooth and console Helen and gently break the news to her that she had been the dupe of an unscrupulous criminal.

column2: He had been on the point of bursting through the window and somehow scrambling aloft to the rescue of that helpless being who was being ground and wrenched and pounded by that porcine monster, when the monster suddenly rose to view again with a dumb-bell in each hand.
column3: He had been on the point of bursting through the window and somehow scrambling aloft to the rescue of that helpless being who was being ground and wrenched and pounded by that porcine monster, when the monster suddenly rose to view again with a dumb bell in each hand.

column2: There was no passion in the stodgy movements of the great paddy arms.

column2: Then suddenly the huge man stooped and held up in plain view a dangling wrestling dummy.

column2: Sure 'twas exercisin' an' not murther he was doin', Phelan hissed through his teeth.

column2: His anger was white hot.

column2: Again he had been the victim of delusion and had wasted heroic emotions on a stuffed dummy that served merely as an inanimate instrument in a course of anti-fat calisthenics.
column3: Again he had been the victim of delusion and had wasted heroic emotions on a stuffed dummy that served merely as an inanimate instrument in a course of anti fat calisthenics.

column2: Fer the love o' hivin, he cried, "give me me uniform and let me out o' here."

column2: There's work for you right in this house."

column2: Oh, so you've resigned from the force?

column2: I'll give you one chance--get away from here as quickly as you can."
column3: I'll give you one chance-get away from here as quickly as you can."

column3: The big fellow curled one corner of his lip in a contemptuous smile, then glanced about him quickly and asked:

column3: Where's the young lady?

column2: The young man spun half a dozen times as he reeled across the carpet and he had to use both hands to stop himself against a big onyx table. As he pulled himself up standing he saw that Watkins had lifted the trunk on his shoulders and was headed for the hallway.

column3: You'll find it's no joke, officer, said the bogus Gladwin sharply-"not if he gets away."

column2: Now be careful, officer, or you'll get yourself into a lot of trouble.
column3: Now be careful, officer, or you'll get yourself into a lot of trouble.

column2: Don't let him bluff you, Phelan, cautioned Gladwin.

column2: Why he's got his pals hidden all over the house.

column2: You mean the women, he said, ignoring Gladwin and addressing the thief.
column3: You mean the women, he said, ignoring Gladwin and addressing the thief.
